name: Orbicularis oculi
Action: Closes eye (squint) lowers eyebrows

name: Orbicularis oris
Action: Closes lips(purses,protrudes)

name: Zygomaticus major
Action: Raises corners of mouth (smile)
Insertion: Skin and muscle at corner of mouth

name: Frontalis
Action: Raise eyebrows

name: Masseter
Action: Elevates mandible (as in closing mouth while chewing)

name: Temporalis
Action: Elevates mandible

name: Platysma
Action: Pulls lower lip down (as in frowning) Depressed mandible (opening mputh as when chewing or surprised)

name: Sternocleidomastoid
Action: Both sides: flexes neck(as in looking down). One side: cocks head

name: Splenius capitis
Action: Both sides: extends neck (as in looking up) One side: cocks head

name: Deltoid (anterior)
Action: Flexion and medial rotation of humerus at shoulder

name: Deltoid (middle)
Action: Abducts humerus at shoulder (as in upwards flap)

name: Deltoid (posterior)
Action: Extension and lateral rotation of humerus at shoulder

name: Pectoralis major
Action: Flexion, adduction, medial rotation of humerus at shoulder (as in overhead fist raise, or bench press motion)
Origin: Sternum to rib 7 Medial half of clavicle

name: Latissimus dorsi
Action: Extension, adduction, medially rotationhumerus at shoulder (gym lat pull-downs)
Origin: T7 to L5, ribs 10 to 12, iliac crest
Insertion: Intertubercular goove of humerus (muscle travels under axillary region)

name: Subscapularis
Action: Medially rotates humerus at shoulder. Stabilizes shoulder.

name: Supraspinatus
Action: Abducts arm at shoulder. Stabilizes shoulder .
Insertion: Greater tubercle of top of humerus

name: Infraspinatus
Action: Laterally rotates humerus at shoulder. Stabilizes shoulder.
Insertion: Middle part of greater tubercle of posterior humerus

name: Teres minor
Action: Laterally rotates humerus at shoulder. Stabilizes shoulder.
Insertion: Inferior part of greater tubercle of posterior humerus

name: Levator scapulae
Action: Elevates and retracts scapula (as in bringing shoulder up and in toward ear)
Insertion: Medial border of scapula, superior to spine

name: Rhomboideus major
Action: Retracts scapula (as in pulling the shoulders back)

name: Trapezius (upper)
Action: Elevates scapula (as in shrugging)

name: Trapezius (middle)
Action: Retracts scapula (as in pulling shoulders back)

name: Trapezius (lower)
Action: Retracts and depresses scapula (as in pulling shoulders back and down)

name: Brachialis
Action: Flexes elbow (as in bringing a spoon to your mouth)

name: Pronator teres
Action: Pronates forearm at elbow (as in turning a doorknob laterally)
Origin: Medial epicondyle of humerus, coronoid process of ulna

name: Biceps brachii
Action: Flexes elbow, supinates forearm (as in scooping up water in your hand to drink)
Origin: Long head: supraglenoid tubercle of scapula Short head: coracoid process of scapula

name: Triceps brachii
Action: Extends forearm at elbow (as in lowering a spoon back to the table)
Origin: Long head: infraglenoid tubercle of scapula Lateral head: posterior proximal shaft of humerus Medial head: posterior distal shaft of humerus

name: Buccinator
Action: Compress cheeks(whistling, sucking)

name: Serratus anterior
Action: Protracts scapula (which pushes the arm forward in front of the scapula, as in punching or hugging
Insertion: Anterior surface of vertebral border of scapula

name: Extensor carpi radialis brevis
Action: Extends wrist, radially deviates wrist (aBduction

name: Flexor carpi radialis
Action: Flexes wrist, radially deviates wrist (aBduction)

name: Extensor carpi ulnaris
Action: Extends wrist, ulnar deviates wrist (aDduction)
Origin: Lateral epicondyle of humerus, posterior shaft of ulna

name: Flexor carpi ulnaris
Action: Flexes wrist, ulnar deviates wrist (aDduction)

name: Extensor digitorum
Action: Extends digits of hand, and wrist

name: Flexor digitorum
Action: Flexes digits of the hand, and wrist

name: Spinalis thoracis
Action: One side: lateral flexion of vertebral column. Both sides: extension and hyperextension of vertebral column

name: Rectus abdominis
Action: Compresses abdomen, flexes vertebral column

name: External intercostals
Action: Pulls ribs up toward origin, elevates ribcage to cause inspiration

name: Diaphragm
Action: Diaphragm drops down to enlarge thoracic cavity, causing inspiration
Origin: Xiphoid process, ribs 10 to 12, costal cartilage 5 to 9, lumbar vertebrae 1-5
Insertion: Central tendon (in center of the disc shaped diaphragm)

name: Pectineus
Action: Flexes hip, adducts leg
Insertion: From lesser trochanter to superior part of linea aspera of femur

name: Adductor longus
Action: Flexes hip, adducts leg
Insertion: Linea aspera (shorter insertion than adductor magnus)

name: Adductor magnus
Action: Extends hip, adducts leg

name: Gluteus maximus
Action: Extends hip (as in pushing down while climbing a stair), rotates leg laterally

name: Gracilis
Action: Adducts leg at hip, flexes knee

name: Tensor fasciae latae
Action: (tenses or stabilizes hip and knee joints), abducts leg at hip
Origin: Iliac crest near anterior superior spine

name: Psoas major
Action: Flexes hip (as in lifting leg to place on stair)

name: Sartorius
Action: Flexes hip and flexes knee, laterally rotates thigh (into cross legged position)

name: Biceps femoris
Action: Extends hip, flexes knee, laterally rotates leg
Origin: Long head: Ischial tuberosity Short head: Posterior mid-shaft of femur

name: Semimembranosus
Action: Extends hip, flexes knee

name: Semitendinosus
Action: Extends hip, flexes knee
Insertion: Medial surface of proximal tibia (slightly anterior to insertion of semimembranosus)

name: Vastus lateralis
Action: Extends knee
Origin: Greater trochanter, lateral lip of linea aspera (wraps around to anterior surface)

name: Vastus medialis
Action: Extends knee
Origin: Intertrochanteric line, medial lip of linea aspera (wraps around to anterior surface)

name: Vastus intermedius
Action: Extends knee

name: Rectus femoris
Action: Extends knee, flexes hip (kicking a ball)
Origin: Anterior inferior iliac spine of coxal bone

name: Soleus
Action: Plantar flexion at ankle
Origin: Proximal third of tibia and fibula

name: Gastrocnemius
Action: Plantar flexion at ankle, flexes knee
Origin: Medial and lateral epicondyles of femur

name: Tibialis anterior
Action: Dorsiflexion and inversion at ankle
